questions.question: While using the AI, I noticed patterns across its answers.
I tried to generalize from the AI’s specific outputs to broader ideas.
I felt confident making conclusions based on a few examples the AI gave me.
After seeing similar answers from the AI, I would:
options: Infer a general principle from those answers (+1)
Wait until I had more data before deciding

questions.question: If AI gave me three similar suggestions for solving a problem, I assumed:
I applied rules or principles I already knew while interpreting the AI’s output.
I used the AI’s general explanation to figure out what I should do in my specific case.
I looked for clear cause-and-effect logic in the AI’s answers.
If the AI explained a rule that applies to all cases, I used it to:
options: Deduce what to do in my specific situation (+1)
Wait until I could test it myself
Disregard the rule unless someone else confirmed it

questions.question: When AI gave me a policy or guideline, I:
options: Applied it directly to my own situation (+1)
Ignored it until I had confirmation

questions.question: I broke down my problem into smaller parts.
I reviewed the AI’s response step by step.
I relied on systematic checking rather than intuition when judging the AI’s response.
When exploring a new feature in AI, I would:
options: Test one function at a time (+1)

questions.question: After getting a long AI response, I typically:
options: Break it into smaller sections and review carefully (+1)

questions.question: I compared the AI’s response to situations I’ve solved before.
I thought about how the AI’s suggestions were like other tools or problems I know.
I used analogies or metaphors to make sense of what the AI told me.
If I didn’t understand an AI explanation, I would:
options: Relate it to something familiar to me (+1)
Drop the question and move on
Wait for someone else to explain it

questions.question: When troubleshooting an AI mistake, I:
options: Compared it to errors I’ve seen in other systems (+1)
Treated it as a one-time event

questions.question: I questioned whether the AI’s answer was accurate.
I checked if the AI’s explanation was backed by evidence or reasoning.
I considered multiple perspectives before accepting the AI’s output.
When the AI gave me an answer, I:
options: Evaluated whether it fit my context (+1)

questions.question: If the AI’s response conflicted with something I already knew, I:
options: Weighed both sides and looked for more evidence (+1)
Chose whichever matched my existing view

questions.question: I adjusted my approach when the AI gave me new information.
Even if I had an initial idea, I was open to changing it after seeing the AI’s output.
I quickly adapted when the AI suggested something unexpected.
If the AI suggested a different solution than my original plan, I would:
options: Consider adapting my plan based on the suggestion (+1)
Stick with my original plan no matter what
Ignore both and look for another source

questions.question: After receiving feedback from the AI that challenged my assumption, I:
I preferred to let the AI do most of the thinking for me.
I found myself relying on the AI instead of working through the solution myself.
I engaged deeply with the AI’s responses rather than just copying them (reverse scored).
When given a choice between solving the problem myself or asking AI, I usually:
options: Ask AI and use its full response (+1)
Ask AI but then rework the answer myself
Avoid using AI for this type of task

questions.question: After the AI gave me a response, I:
options: Copied it directly without much modification (+1)

questions.question: I trusted the AI’s answers without much verification.
I felt cautious about whether the AI’s responses could be wrong (reverse scored).
I felt confident that the AI was providing reliable information.
When AI gave me a detailed solution, I:
If the AI gave me an answer that conflicted with my prior knowledge, I:
I felt confident interpreting the AI’s responses.
I knew how to judge when the AI’s answers were useful for my situation.
I understood the limitations of what the AI can and cannot do.
After interacting with AI, I feel my understanding of its strengths and limits is:
If I needed to explain to a coworker how to use this AI tool effectively, I could:
